TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PackagePart extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for parts stored in a . This class is abstract.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A PackagePart consists of three basic elements:
|Access|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Uri%2A>|The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the part.| |<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.ContentType%2A>|The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type of the content stream.| |<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.GetStream%2A>|The content data stream of the part.|

MemberSignature.Value: protected PackagePart (System.IO.Packaging.Package package, Uri partUri);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IO.Packaging.Package package, class System.Uri partUri) cil managed

Docs.param: The parent of the part.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the part, relative to the parent root.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> and part [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)].

remarks.format:
## Remarks `partUri` must be valid <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] formed in accordance with the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification and the [Open Packaging Conventions](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255) specification.
Use this constructor when the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.ContentType%2A> of the part is not immediately known and will be set later when <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.CreatePart%2A> is called.
By default, the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.CompressionOption%2A> property of the part is initialized to <xref:System.IO.Packaging.CompressionOption>.

Docs.exception: or is .

MemberSignature.Value: protected PackagePart (System.IO.Packaging.Package package, Uri partUri, string contentType);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IO.Packaging.Package package, class System.Uri partUri, string contentType) cil managed

Docs.param: The parent of the part.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the part, relative to the parent root.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] content type of the part data stream.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A>, part [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)], and [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] content type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `partUri` must be valid <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] formed in accordance with the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification and the [Open Packaging Conventions](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255) specification.
By default, the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.CompressionOption%2A> property of the part is initialized to <xref:System.IO.Packaging.CompressionOption>.
`contentType` must be a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type formed in accordance with the [RFC 2616](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html) *Hypertext Transfer Protocol - HTTP*, Section 3.7. The following table shows an example of the content [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] types used in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] documents.
|Description|Content Type| |-----------------|------------------| |Font|application/vnd.ms-opentype| |ICC profile|application/vnd.ms-color.iccprofile| |JPEG image|image/jpeg| |Obfuscated font|application/vnd.ms-package.obfuscated-opentype| |PNG image|image/png| |PrintTicket|application/vnd.ms-printing.printticket+xml| |TIFF image|image/tiff| |Windows Media Photo image|image/vnd.ms-photo|

Docs.exception: or is .
is not a valid [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)].

remarks.format:
## Remarks `partUri` must be valid <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] formed in accordance with the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification and the [Open Packaging Conventions](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255) specification.
`contentType` must be a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type formed in accordance with the [RFC 2616](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html) *Hypertext Transfer Protocol - HTTP*, Section 3.7. The following table shows an example of the content [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] types used in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] documents.
|Description|Content Type| |-----------------|------------------| |Font|application/vnd.ms-opentype| |ICC profile|application/vnd.ms-color.iccprofile| |JPEG image|image/jpeg| |Obfuscated font|application/vnd.ms-package.obfuscated-opentype| |PNG image|image/png| |PrintTicket|application/vnd.ms-printing.printticket+xml| |TIFF image|image/tiff| |Windows Media Photo image|image/vnd.ms-photo|

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.CompressionOption CompressionOption { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.IO.Packaging.CompressionOption CompressionOption

Docs.summary: Gets the compression option of the part content stream.
Docs.value: The compression option of the part content stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks CompressionOption is a read-only property that can be accessed only when the parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> is open.
The CompressionOption property is automatically set by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.%23ctor%2A> constructor. After it is set by the constructor, the CompressionOption cannot be changed.

The part has been deleted.
-or-

MemberSignature.Value: public string ContentType { get; }
.property instance string ContentType

Docs.summary: Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type of the content stream.
Docs.value: The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type of the content data stream for the part.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ContentType is a read-only property that can be accessed only when the parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> is open.
The ContentType property is automatically set by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.%23ctor%2A> constructor. After it is set by the constructor, the ContentType cannot be changed.
The ContentType property is a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type formed in accordance with the [RFC 2616](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html) *Hypertext Transfer Protocol - HTTP*, Section 3.7. The following table shows an example of the content [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] types used in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] documents.
|Description|Content Type| |-----------------|------------------| |Font|application/vnd.ms-opentype| |ICC profile|application/vnd.ms-color.iccprofile| |JPEG image|image/jpeg| |Obfuscated font|application/vnd.ms-package.obfuscated-opentype| |PNG image|image/png| |PrintTicket|application/vnd.ms-printing.printticket+xml| |TIFF image|image/tiff| |Windows Media Photo image|image/vnd.ms-photo|

Docs.exception:
The part has been deleted.
-or-
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> is not open (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Dispose%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Close%2A> has been called).
-or-
The string returned by the derived class <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.GetContentTypeCore%2A> method is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship CreateRelationship (Uri targetUri, System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode targetMode, string relationshipType);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship CreateRelationship(class System.Uri targetUri, valuetype System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode targetMode, string relationshipType) cil managed

Docs.param: The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the target part.
One of the enumeration values. For example, if the target part is inside the ; or if the target is a resource outside the .
The role of the relationship.
Docs.summary: Creates a part-level relationship between this to a specified target or external resource.
Docs.returns: The part-level relationship between this to the target or external resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A part-level relationship defines an association between this part and a target part or resource. A part-level relationship can be one of two forms.
- Between a source <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> to a target <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> inside the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package>.
- Between a source <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> to a target resource outside the package.
In a part-relationship the source part is considered the "owner" of the relationship. When the source part is deleted, all the relationships owned by the part are also deleted. The process of creating or deleting the relationship does not physically alter the target part or resource in any way.
The CreateRelationship method does not physically change either the source part, or the target part or resource in any way.
The target of a relationship cannot be another relationship.
If `targetMode` is specified as <xref:System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode>, `targetUri` must be a relative URI that is formed in accordance with the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification. The internal relative URI can be either an absolute path that starts with a forward slash ("/") character such as "/page1.xaml" or "/images/picture4.jpg", or a relative path such as "../imagespicture1.jpg" that resolves against the package root ("/") as the base URI.
If `targetMode` is specified as <xref:System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode>, `targetUri` can be either an absolute or relative URI formed in accordance with the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification. "http://www.microsoft.com/page2.xml" is an example of an absolute URI that references an external target resource "page2.xml". "images/picture1.jpg" is an example of a relative URI that also references an external target resource "1.jpg" but which resolves against the URI of the package itself.
`relationshipType` must be a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that is formed according to the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification. Different package types can define different part-level relationship types. The following table shows the part-level `relationshipType` URIs defined for documents that conform to the *Open XML Paper Specification (XPS)*.
|XPS Document Part-Level Relationship|Relationship Type URI| |-------------------------------------------|---------------------------| |Digital Signature Definitions|[http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/signature-definitions](http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/signature-definitions)| |DiscardControl|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/discard-control| |DocumentStructure|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/documentstructure| |PrintTicket|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/printticket| |Required Resource|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/required-resource| |Restricted Font|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/restricted-font| |StartPart|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/fixedrepresentation| |StoryFragments|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/storyfragments|
For more information about package relationships see section 1.3 of the *Open Packaging Conventions (OPC)* specification available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
For more information about XPS documents see the *Open XML Paper Specification (XPS)* available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=67000](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=67000).

Docs.exception:
The part has been deleted.
-or-
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> is not open (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Dispose%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Close%2A> has been called).
or is .
The parameter is not a valid enumeration value.

The part identified by the is a relationship (the target of a relationship cannot be another relationship).
-or-
is specified as but is an absolute external [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)].
The package is read-only (a new relationship cannot be added).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship CreateRelationship (Uri targetUri, System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode targetMode, string relationshipType, string id);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship CreateRelationship(class System.Uri targetUri, valuetype System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode targetMode, string relationshipType, string id) cil managed

Docs.param: The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the target part.
One of the enumeration values. For example, if the target part is inside the ; or if the target is a resource outside the .
The role of the relationship.
A unique ID for the relationship.
Docs.summary: Creates a part-level relationship between this to a specified target or external resource.
Docs.returns: The part-level relationship between this to the target or external resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A part-level relationship defines an association between this part and a target part or resource. A part-level relationship can be one of two forms.
- Between a source <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> to a target <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> inside the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package>.
- Between a source <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> to a target resource outside the package.
In a part-relationship the source part is considered the "owner" of the relationship. When the source part is deleted, all the relationships owned by the part are also deleted. The process of creating or deleting the relationship does not physically alter the target part or resource in any way.
`id` must be a valid XML identifier. The `id` type is xsd:ID and must follow the naming conventions prescribed in the *XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes* specification (see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#ID](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)).
The CreateRelationship method does not physically change either the source part, or the target part or resource in any way.
The target of a relationship cannot be another relationship.
If `targetMode` is specified as <xref:System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode>, `targetUri` must be a relative URI that is formed in accordance with the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification. The internal relative URI can be either an absolute path that starts with a forward slash ("/") character such as "/page1.xaml" or "/images/picture4.jpg", or a relative path such as "../imagespicture1.jpg" that resolves against the package root ("/") as the base URI.
If `targetMode` is specified as <xref:System.IO.Packaging.TargetMode>, `targetUri` can be either an absolute or relative URI formed in accordance with the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification. "http://www.microsoft.com/page2.xml" is an example of an absolute URI that references an external target resource "page2.xml". "images/picture1.jpg" is an example of a relative URI that also references an external target resource "1.jpg" but which resolves against the URI of the package itself.
`relationshipType` must be a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that is formed according to the [RFC 3986](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) *Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) Generic Syntax* specification. Different package types can define different part-level relationship types. The following table shows the part-level `relationshipType` URIs defined for documents that conform to the *Open XML Paper Specification (XPS)*.
|XPS Document Part-Level Relationship|Relationship Type URI| |-------------------------------------------|---------------------------| |Digital Signature Definitions|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/signature-definitions| |DiscardControl|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/discard-control| |DocumentStructure|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/documentstructure| |PrintTicket|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/printticket| |Required Resource|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/required-resource| |Restricted Font|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/restricted-font| |StartPart|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/fixedrepresentation| |StoryFragments|http://schemas.microsoft.com/xps/2005/06/storyfragments|
For more information about package relationships see section 1.3 of the *Open Packaging Conventions (OPC)* specification available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
For more information about XPS documents see the *Open XML Paper Specification (XPS)* available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=67000](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=67000).

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteRelationship (string id);
.method public hidebysig instance void DeleteRelationship(string id) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.Id%2A> of the relationship to delete.
Docs.summary: Deletes a specified part-level .

remarks.format:
## Remarks `id` must be a valid XML identifier. The `id` type is xsd:ID and must follow the naming conventions prescribed in the *XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes* specification (see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#ID](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)).
If the specified `id` does not match the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.Id%2A> for any of the relationships that are owned by this part, no relationship is deleted and no exception is thrown.
Other than deleting the specified relationship, the DeleteRelationship method does not physically change either this part or the target part.

Docs.exception:
The part has been deleted.
-or-
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> is not open (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Dispose%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Close%2A> has been called).
is .
The package is read-only (relationships cannot be deleted).
is not a valid XML identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual string GetContentTypeCore ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetContentTypeCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type of the part content.
Docs.returns: The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] type of the part content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks GetContentTypeCore is a virtual method of the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> abstract base class. Implement this method only in derived types where the value for the content type cannot be provided at the time of construction, or if calculating the content type value is a nontrivial or costly operation. The return value must be a valid [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_mime](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-mime-md.md)] content type.
Derived classes can call GetContentTypeCore to initialize the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.ContentType%2A> property of the derived class to a default value. After the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.ContentType%2A> property has been set it cannot be changed.

Docs.exception: The derived class does not provide an override implementation required for the GetContentTypeCore method.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship GetRelationship (string id);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship GetRelationship(string id) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.Id%2A> of the relationship to return.
Docs.summary: Returns the relationship that has a specified <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.Id%2A>.
Docs.returns: The relationship that matches the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks `id` must be a valid XML identifier. The `id` type is xsd:ID and must follow the naming conventions prescribed in the *XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes* specification (see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#ID](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)).
You can use the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.RelationshipExists%2A> method to determine if a relationship with a specified <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.Id%2A> is owned by this part.

Docs.exception: is .
is not a valid XML identifier.
is an empty string.

-or-

The package is write-only (relationship information cannot be read).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationshipCollection GetRelationships ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationshipCollection GetRelationships() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a collection of all the relationships that are owned by this part.
Docs.returns: A collection of all the relationships that are owned by the part.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned collection is never `null`; however, the collection might contain zero elements if the part does not define any relationships.

The package is write-only (relationship information cannot be read).

.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationshipCollection GetRelationshipsByType(string relationshipType) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.RelationshipType%2A> of the relationships to locate and return in the collection.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of the relationships that match a specified <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.RelationshipType%2A>.
Docs.returns: A collection of the relationships that match the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned collection is never `null`; however, the collection might contain zero elements if no relationships match the specified `relationshipType` that is defined for the part.
Any leading or trailing spaces in the `relationshipType` string are automatically trimmed.

The package is write-only (relationship information cannot be read).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Stream GetStream ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Stream GetStream() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the part content data stream.
Docs.returns: The content data stream for the part.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method opens the content stream with <xref:System.IO.FileMode> of <xref:System.IO.FileMode> and <xref:System.IO.FileAccess> permissions that are the same as the parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package>.
The overload <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.GetStream%2A> method allows you to set a specific <xref:System.IO.FileMode>.

Docs.exception:
The part has been deleted.
-or-
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> is not open (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Dispose%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Close%2A> has been called).
The stream object returned by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.GetStreamCore%2A> method of the derived subclass is .

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Stream GetStream (System.IO.FileMode mode);

Docs.param: The I/O mode in which to open the content stream.
Docs.summary: Returns the content stream opened in a specified I/O .
Docs.returns: The content stream of the part.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.FileAccess> permissions of the returned content stream are the same as the permissions of the parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package>.

Docs.exception:
The part has been deleted.

The parameter is not a valid enumeration value.

The parameter is not compatible with the package and part stream.
-or-
The stream object returned by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.GetStreamCore%2A> method of the derived subclass is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Applications should not call GetStreamCore directly, but instead should call <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.GetStream%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IO.Packaging.Package Package { get; }
.property instance class System.IO.Packaging.Package Package

Docs.summary: Gets the parent of the part.
Docs.value: The parent package of the part.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Package is a read-only property that can be accessed only when the parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> is open.
The Package property is automatically set by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.%23ctor%2A> constructor. After it is set by the constructor, the parent Package for the part cannot be changed.

Docs.exception:
The part has been deleted.
-or-
The Package is not open (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Dispose%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Close%2A> has been called).

MemberSignature.Value: public bool RelationshipExists (string id);
.method public hidebysig instance bool RelationshipExists(string id) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.Id%2A> of the relationship to check for.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this part owns a relationship with a specified <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageRelationship.Id%2A>.
Docs.returns: if this part owns a relationship with the specified ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `id` must be a valid XML identifier. The `id` type is xsd:ID and must follow the naming conventions prescribed in the *XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes* specification (see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#ID](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)).

Docs.exception: is .
is not a valid XML identifier.

The part has been deleted.
-or-
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> is not open (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Dispose%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Close%2A> has been called).
The package is write-only (relationship information cannot be read).

MemberSignature.Value: public Uri Uri { get; }
.property instance class System.Uri Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the part.
Docs.value: The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the part relative to the package root.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Uri is a read-only property that can be accessed only when the parent <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> is open.
The Uri property is automatically set by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.%23ctor%2A> constructor. After it is set by the constructor, the Uri of the part cannot be changed.

Docs.exception:
The part has been deleted.
-or-
The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.Package%2A> is not open (<xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Dispose%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package.Close%2A> has been called).
